intro: Machaerium acutifolium var. pseudacutifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved machaerium, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, pinnate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, flat pods that contain several seeds. This species is often found in disturbed habitats and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
